functions.name: shiftedBounds
functions.description: Shifts the coordinates of the given bounds using the provided x and y axis offset.

functions.name: resizedBounds
functions.description: Resizes the coordinates of the given bounds using the provided width and height.

functions.name: relativeBounds
functions.description: Shifts the coordinates of the given bounds so they are relative to the offset.

attributes.name: Sprite
attributes.description:
A Sprite is our handle to a DOM element that we want to animate.

It manages locking and unlocking the element (which means taking it in and out of static document flow so it's readily animatable).

It tracks the sprite's current transform.

It tracks the sprite's initial and/or final bounds, as measured from the actual pre- and/or post-animation DOM.

methods.name: getInitialDimension
methods.description:
Returns the attribute value from the initial position object with the given name.

This is mostly intended for use with SVG, where you can say things like getInitialDimension('x').

methods.name: getFinalDimension
methods.description:
Returns the attribute value from the final position object with the given name.

This is mostly intended for use with SVG, where you can say things like getFinalDimension('x').

methods.name: initialCumulativeTransform
methods.description: Analogous to initialBounds, this is a snapshot of the cumulative effect of all transforms on this sprite at the start of animation.

methods.name: finalCumulativeTransform
methods.description: Analogous to finalBounds, this is a snapshot of the cumulative effect of all transforms on this sprite at the end of animation.

methods.name: originalInitialBounds
methods.description: Some things methods (like startAtSprite, startAtPixel, etc) can set or alter the initialBounds. This gives you access to the original value (which may be undefined if this sprite didn't have any initial bounds, which is the case for newly inserted sprites).

methods.name: originalFinalBounds
methods.description: Some things (like endAtSprite) can alter the finalBounds. This gives you access to the original value (which may be undefined if the sprite didn't have any final bounds, which is the case for removedSprites).

methods.name: _getCurrentPosition
methods.description:
Returns the current position of the element as an object.

This deliberately only tracks inline styles, because it's only important when the user is manipulating inline styles.

methods.name: _reapplyPosition
methods.description: Sets the position of the element.

methods.name: difference
methods.description:
Returns the difference between two sprites, represented as x and y coordinates.

this.difference('initialBounds', other, 'finalBounds') is interpreted as "the difference between this sprite's initial bounds and the other sprite's final bounds".

It works this way because each sprite has its own local coordinate system.

methods.name: applyStyles
methods.description:
This is your general purpose hook for changing CSS properties of the sprite's element. Use this when there's not a more specific method like translate(), scale(), hide(), or reveal().

Nothing you do to the sprite will persist after the transition is finished -- we clean things up when it ends.

params.name: styles
params.description: The styles to apply to the sprite.

methods.name: hide
methods.description: Hides the sprite using CSS visibility property.

methods.name: reveal
methods.description:
Reveals the sprite using CSS visibility property.

Newly inserted sprites start hidden, and are revealed when you start animating them. You can manually reveal them with this if you want them to appear right away and you're not animating them.

methods.name: display
methods.description:
Manages the application of the ember-animated-none CSS class on the element.

When the flag is truthy, the class is removed and the element is therefore visible.

When the flag is falsy, the class is applied and the element is therefore hidden.

methods.name: translate
methods.description:
Translates the sprite by the given number of screen pixels.

Disregards any pre-existing transforms.

params.name: dx
params.description: The number of screen pixels on the x axis.

params.name: dy
params.description: The number of screen pixels on the y axis.

methods.name: scale
methods.description: Adjusts the sprite's scale by the given scaling factors.

params.name: scaleX
params.description: The scaling factor to apply to the x axis.

params.name: scaleY
params.description: The scaling factor to apply to the y axis.

methods.name: rehome
methods.description: Adjusts the sprite so it will still be in the same visual position despite being moved into a new offset parent.

methods.name: startAtSprite
methods.description: Sets the sprite's initialBounds relative to the provided otherSprite.

methods.name: startAtPixel
methods.description: Sets the sprite's initialBounds using the provided x and y coordinates.

methods.name: startTranslatedBy
methods.description: Sets the sprite's initialBounds relative to its finalBounds.

methods.name: moveToFinalPosition
methods.description: Moves the sprite to its final position (finalBounds).

methods.name: endAtSprite
methods.description: Sets the sprite's finalBounds using the provided otherSprite.

methods.name: endAtPixel
methods.description: Sets the sprite's finalBounds using the provided point (x, y).

methods.name: endTranslatedBy
methods.description: Sets the sprite's finalBounds using its initialBounds and the provided x and y axis offset.

methods.name: endRelativeTo
methods.description: Sets this sprite's finalBounds so that its position relative to the otherSprite remains constant through the transition.

params.name: otherSprite
params.description: Note: must have initial and final bounds

accessors.name: initialBounds
accessors.description:
A DOMRect representing the place where this sprite will start the transition. Not every sprite has initialBounds (a newly inserted sprite will not -- it will only have finalBounds).

The position is measured relative to our offsetParent, if we have one. Most of the time we want motions to act in relative terms, so that if we're inside another animator things still work out correctly.

You can manipulate initialBounds using methods like startAtPixel.

Motions should look at initialBounds and finalBounds to decide what to do.

accessors.name: absoluteInitialBounds
accessors.description: Like initialBounds, but relative to the screen, not the offset parent. Most of the time you don't want this one, because your motion will be more robust to ancestor motion if you do everything in relative terms.

accessors.name: finalBounds
accessors.description:
A DOMRect representing the place where this sprite will end the transition. Not every sprite has finalBounds (a sprite that is about to be destroyed will not -- it will only have initialBounds).

The position is measured relative to our offsetParent, if we have one. Most of the time we want motions to act in relative terms, so that if we're inside another animator things still work out correctly.

You can manipulate finalBounds using methods like endAtPixel.

accessors.name: absoluteFinalBounds
accessors.description: Like initialBounds, but relative to the screen, not the offset parent. Most of the time you don't want this one, because your motion will be more robust to ancestor motion if you do everything in relative terms.

accessors.name: initialComputedStyle
accessors.description:
A snapshot of the sprite's computed style at the start of the transition. We don't copy every possible property, see COPIED_CSS_PROPERTIES.

This is powered by getComputedStyle, so the property names and values will follow those semantics.

Not every sprite will have an initialComputedStyle (insertedSprites do not).

accessors.name: finalComputedStyle
accessors.description:
A snapshot of the sprite's computed style at the end of the transition. We don't copy every possible property, see COPIED_CSS_PROPERTIES.

This is powered by getComputedStyle, so the property names and values will follow those semantics.

Not every sprite will have a finalComputedStyle (removedSprites do not).

accessors.name: transform
accessors.description: Returns the sprite's current transform, with appropriate caching so that you don't trigger reflows.

accessors.name: cumulativeTransform
accessors.description: This is different from this.transform because it's the product of our own transform and all ancestor transforms. It's what you need if you want to understand how many real screen pixels there are to every local pixel in the sprite.

accessors.name: revealed
accessors.description: Returns wether the sprite is revealed or not.

functions.name: cumulativeTransform
functions.description: Returns a Transform instance representing the cumulative CSS transform of this element and all its ancestors.

attributes.name: animated-beacon
attributes.description:
A component that marks a region of the page that can serve as a source or destination for other animator components. See Animating Between Components. 

  {{#animated-beacon group="one"}}
    <button {{action "launch"}}>Launch</button>
  {{/animated-beacon}}

  {{#animated-if showThing group="one" use=transition duration=500}}
    <div class="message" {{action "dismiss"}}>
      Hello
    </div>
  {{/animated-if}}

import Component from '@ember/component';
import move from 'ember-animated/motions/move';
import scale from 'ember-animated/motions/scale';
import { parallel } from 'ember-animated';

export default Component.extend({
  showThing: false,

  transition: function * ({ receivedSprites, sentSprites }) {
    receivedSprites.forEach(parallel(scale, move));
    sentSprites.forEach(parallel(scale, move));
  },

  actions: {
    launch() {
      this.set('showThing', true);
    },
    dismiss() {
      this.set('showThing', false);
    }
  }
});

attributes.name: animated-container
attributes.description:
Provides a boundary between animator components and the surrounding document which smoothly resizes as animators change. Use animated-container whenever you need to "hold a place for" some animated content while that content is animating. 

 <button {{action toggleThing}}>Toggle</button>
 {{#animated-container}}
   {{#animated-if showThing use=transition }}
       <div class="message" {{action "toggleThing"}}>
           Hello!
       </div>
   {{/animated-if}}
 {{/animated-container}}
 <p>
   This is outside of the container.
 </p>

 import Component from '@ember/component';
 import move from 'ember-animated/motions/move';
 import {easeOut, easeIn } from 'ember-animated/easings/cosine';

 export default Component.extend({
   showThing: false,

   toggleThing() {
     this.set('showThing', !this.get('showThing'));
   },

   transition: function * ({ insertedSprites, keptSprites, removedSprites }) {
     insertedSprites.forEach(sprite => {
       sprite.startAtPixel({ x: window.innerWidth });
       move(sprite, { easing: easeOut });
     });

     keptSprites.forEach(move);

     removedSprites.forEach(sprite => {
       sprite.endAtPixel({ x: window.innerWidth });
       move(sprite, { easing: easeIn });
     });
   },
 });

arguments.name: onInitialRender
arguments.description: Whether to animate the initial render. You will probably also need to set initialInsertion=true on a child component of animated-container. Defaults to false.

attributes.name: animated-each
attributes.description:
A drop in replacement for {{#each}} that animates changes to a list.

{{#animated-each items use=transition duration=2000 as |item|}}
  <div data-test-item={{item}} onclick={{action removeItem item}}>
    {{item}}
  </div>
{{/animated-each}}

import Component from '@ember/component';
import move from 'ember-animated/motions/move';
import { fadeOut } from 'ember-animated/motions/opacity';

export default Component.extend({
  init() {
    this._super();
    this.items = ['A', 'B', 'C', 'D', 'E'];
  },

  * transition({ keptSprites, removedSprites }) {
    keptSprites.forEach(move);
    removedSprites.forEach(fadeOut);
  },

  removeItem(item){
    this.set('items', this.items.filter(i => i !== item));
  }
});

arguments.name: items
arguments.description: The list of data you are trying to render.

arguments.name: group
arguments.description: If set, this animator will only match other animators that have the same group value.

arguments.name: duration
arguments.description: Represents the amount of time an animation takes in miliseconds.

arguments.name: use
arguments.description: Specifies the Transition to run when the list changes.

arguments.name: rules
arguments.description: Specifies data-dependent Rules that choose which Transition to run when the list changes. This takes precedence over use.

arguments.name: initialInsertion
arguments.description: When true, all the items in the list will animate as insertedSprites when the {{#animated-each}} is first rendered. Defaults to false.

arguments.name: finalRemoval
arguments.description: When true, all the items in the list will animate as removedSprites when the {{#animated-each}} is destroyed. Defaults to false.

arguments.name: key
arguments.description: Serves the same purpose as the key in ember {{#each}}, and it's also used to compare values when animating between components.

attributes.name: animated-if
attributes.description:
A drop in replacement for {{#if}} that animates changes when the predicate changes. Animated-if uses the same arguments as animated-each.

<button {{action toggleThing}}>Toggle</button>
{{#animated-if showThing use=transition}}
    <div class="message" {{action "toggleThing"}}>
        myContent
    </div>
{{/animated-if}}

import Component from '@ember/component';
import move from 'ember-animated/motions/move';
import {easeOut, easeIn } from 'ember-animated/easings/cosine';

export default Component.extend({
  showThing: false,

  toggleThing() {
    this.set('showThing', !this.get('showThing'));
  },

  transition: function * ({ insertedSprites, keptSprites, removedSprites }) {
    insertedSprites.forEach(sprite => {
      sprite.startAtPixel({ x: window.innerWidth });
      move(sprite, { easing: easeOut });
    });

    keptSprites.forEach(move);

    removedSprites.forEach(sprite => {
      sprite.endAtPixel({ x: window.innerWidth });
      move(sprite, { easing: easeIn });
    });
  },
});

attributes.name: animated-orphans
attributes.description:
A component that adopts any orphaned sprites so they can continue animating even after their original parent component has been destroyed. This relies on cloning DOM nodes, and the cloned nodes will be inserted as children of animated-orphans. 

{{animated-orphans}}

attributes.name: animated-value
attributes.description:
A component that animates when a single value changes. Animated-value uses the same arguments as animated-each.

  {{#animated-container}}
    {{#animated-value counter rules=rules duration=100 as |v|}}
        <span class="numbers">{{v}}</span>
    {{/animated-value}}
  {{/animated-container}}

  <button {{action "increment"}}>+</button>
  <button {{action "decrement"}}>-</button>

import Component from '@ember/component';
import { toLeft, toRight } from 'ember-animated/transitions/move-over';

export default Component.extend({
  rules({ oldItems, newItems }) {
    if (oldItems[0] < newItems[0]) {
      return toLeft;
    } else {
      return toRight;
    }
  },

  counter: 10,

  actions: {
    increment() {
      this.set('counter', this.get('counter') + 1);
    },
    decrement() {
      this.set('counter', this.get('counter') - 1);
    }
  }
});
